title: Prohibits tax credits against real property tax for franchise fees collected and remitted by cable television companies to assessing units
summary: Prohibits a cable company from receiving tax credits against real property tax for franchise fees collected and remitted by such cable television companies to assessing units.

       Introduced by M. of A. CAHILL -- read once and referred to the Committee

       AN  ACT  to  amend the real property tax law, in relation to prohibiting
         tax credits against real property tax for franchise fees collected and
         remitted by cable television companies to assessing units

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 1 of section 626 of the real property tax law
    2  is amended and a new subdivision 5 is added to read as follows:
    3    1.  When a tax levied on a special franchise is due in  any  assessing
    4  unit,  if  the  special franchise owner has paid such assessing unit for
    5  its exclusive use during the past year under any  agreement  or  statute
    6  requiring  the  same, a sum based upon a percentage of gross earnings or
    7  other income, a license fee, EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION  FIVE  OF
    8  THIS SECTION, or other sum of money on account of such special franchise
    9  possessed  by  such  special  franchise  owner, which payment was in the
   10  nature of a tax, all amounts so paid  for  the  exclusive  use  of  such
   11  assessing  unit,  except  money paid or expended for paving or repairing
   12  the pavement of a street, highway or public place, and except in a  city
   13  having a population of one hundred seventy-five thousand or more accord-
   14  ing to the latest federal census, car license fees or tolls paid for the
   15  privilege of crossing a bridge owned by the city, shall be deducted from
   16  the  tax based on the assessment made by the state board for purposes of
   17  the assessing unit, but not otherwise, and the remainder  shall  be  the
   18  tax on such special franchise payable for such purposes.
